constants.name: Github
constants.description: A Node.JS module, which provides an object oriented wrapper for the GitHub v3 API.

files.description: Files that make up this gist. The key of which should be a required string filename and the value another required hash with parameters: 'content'

ref.description: String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesnâ€™t have at least one slash, it will be rejected.

color.invalidmsg: 6 character hex code, without a leading #.
color.description: 6 character hex code, without a leading #.

permission.description: `pull` - team members can pull, but not push or administer this repositories (Default), `push` - team members can pull and push, but not administer this repositores, `admin` - team members can pull, push and administer these repositories.

base.description: The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo.

head.description: The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented.

commit_id.invalidmsg: Sha of the commit to comment on.
commit_id.description: Sha of the commit to comment on.

line.invalidmsg: Line index in the diff to comment on.
line.description: Line index in the diff to comment on.

path.invalidmsg: Relative path of the file to comment on.
path.description: Relative path of the file to comment on.

position.invalidmsg: Column index in the diff to comment on.
position.description: Column index in the diff to comment on.

private.description: True to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false.

has_issues.description: True to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.

has_wiki.description: True to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true.

has_downloads.description: True to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.

default_branch.description: Updates the default branch for this repository.

page.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

per_page.description: A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30.

scopes.description: A list of scopes that this authorization is in.

note.description: A note to remind you what the OAuth token is for.

note_url.description: A URL to remind you what app the OAuth token is for.

auto_init.description: True to create an initial commit with empty README. Default is false

gitignore_template.description: Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Ignored if auto_init parameter is not provided.

order.invalidmsg: The sort order if sort parameter is provided. One of asc or desc. Default: desc

data.description: Raw data to send as the body of the request

tree.description: String of the SHA of the tree object this commit points to

parents.description: Array of the SHAs of the commits that were the parents of this commit. If omitted or empty, the commit will be written as a root commit. For a single parent, an array of one SHA should be provided, for a merge commit, an array of more than one should be provided.

force.description: Boolean indicating whether to force the update or to make sure the update is a fast-forward update. The default is false, so leaving this out or setting it to false will make sure youâ€™re not overwriting work.

object.description: String of the SHA of the git object this is tagging

type.description: String of the type of the object weâ€™re tagging. Normally this is a commit but it can also be a tree or a blob.

tagger.description: JSON object that contains the following keys: `name` - String of the name of the author of the tag, `email` - String of the email of the author of the tag, `date` - Timestamp of when this object was tagged

tree.description: Array of Hash objects (of path, mode, type and sha) specifying a tree structure

base_tree.description: String of the SHA1 of the tree you want to update with new data

labels.description: String list of comma separated Label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

assignee.description: String User login, `none` for Issues with no assigned User. `*` for Issues with any assigned User.

creator.description: The user that created the issue.

labels.description: String list of comma separated Label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

assignee.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to.

milestone.description: Milestone to associate this issue with.

labels.description: Array of strings - Labels to associate with this issue.

assignee.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to.

milestone.description: Milestone to associate this issue with.

labels.description: Array of strings - Labels to associate with this issue.

add_scopes.description: A list of scopes to add to this authorization.

remove_scopes.description: A list of scopes to remove from this authorization.

billing_email.description: Billing email address. This address is not publicized.

state.description: State of the status - can be one of pending, success, error, or failure.

target_url.description: Target url to associate with this status. This URL will be linked from the GitHub UI to allow users to easily see the â€˜sourceâ€™ of the Status.

context.description: A string label to differentiate this status from the status of other systems.

commit_message.description: The message that will be used for the merge commit

team_id.description: The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repo in an organization.

commit_message.description: Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used.

anon.description: Set to 1 or true to include anonymous contributors in results.

sha.description: Sha or branch to start listing commits from.

path.description: Only commits containing this file path will be returned.

author.description: GitHub login or email address by which to filter by commit author.

path.description: Relative path of the file to comment on.

position.description: Line index in the diff to comment on.

line.description: Line number in the file to comment on. Defaults to 1.

ref.description: The String name of the Commit/Branch/Tag. Defaults to master.
The String name of the Commit/Branch/Tag. Defaults to master.
The String name of the Commit/Branch/Tag. Defaults to master.

content.description: The new file content, Base64 encoded.

branch.description: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master).

content.description: The updated file content, Base64 encoded.

sha.description: The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

branch.description: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master).

sha.description: The blob SHA of the file being removed.

branch.description: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master).

ref.description: String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesnâ€™t have at least one slash, it will be rejected.

organization.description: Organization login. The repository will be forked into this organization.

config.description: A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as `1` for true, and `0` for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

events.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: `['push']`.

active.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

config.description: A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. Modifying this will replace the entire config object. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as `1` for true, and `0` for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

events.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. This replaces the entire array of events. Default: `['push']`.

add_events.description: Determines a list of events to be added to the list of events that the Hook triggers for.

remove_events.description: Determines a list of events to be removed from the list of events that the Hook triggers for.

active.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

sha.description: The short or long sha that was recorded at creation time. Default: none.

ref.description: The name of the ref. This can be a branch, tag, or sha. Default: none.

task.description: The name of the task for the deployment. e.g. deploy or deploy:migrations. Default: none.

environment.description: The name of the environment that was deployed to. e.g. staging or production. Default: none.

ref.description: The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or sha.

task.description: The named task to execute. e.g. deploy or deploy:migrations. Default: deploy

auto_merge.description: Optional parameter to merge the default branch into the requested ref if it is behind the default branch. Default: true

required_contexts.description: Optional array of status contexts verified against commit status checks. If this parameter is omitted from the parameters then all unique contexts will be verified before a deployment is created. To bypass checking entirely pass an empty array. Defaults to all unique contexts.

payload.description: Optional JSON payload with extra information about the deployment. Default: ''

environment.description: The name of the environment that was deployed to. e.g. staging or production. Default: none.

state.description: The state of the status. Can be one of pending, success, error, or failure.

target_url.description: The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment. Default: ''

description.description: A short description of the status. Default: ''

since.description: The integer ID of the last User that youâ€™ve seen.

target_commitish.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master).

draft.description: true to create a draft (unpublished) release, false to create a published one. Default: false

prerelease.description: true to identify the release as a prerelease. false to identify the release as a full release. Default: false

target_commitish.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master).

draft.description: true to create a draft (unpublished) release, false to create a published one. Default: false

prerelease.description: true to identify the release as a prerelease. false to identify the release as a full release. Default: false

name.description: the file name of the asset

label.description: An alternate short description of the asset. Used in place of the filename.

sort.invalidmsg: One of stars, forks, or updated. Default: results are sorted by best match.
Can be followers, repositories, or joined. Default: results are sorted by best match.

mode.description: The rendering mode, `markdown` to render a document as plain Markdown, just like README files are rendered. `gfm` to render a document as user-content, e.g. like user comments or issues are rendered. In GFM mode, hard line breaks are always taken into account, and issue and user mentions are linked accordingly.

context.description: The repository context, only taken into account when rendering as `gfm`

name.description: The name of the .gitignore template to get
